review: We came in restaurant talked to hostess and said that there were gonna set a table 15min later we asked how much longer the hostess told us oh we don't know we don't have enough tables and we don't know how long it's going to be. Five minutes later they sat us at a table for 10 ppl and our party was of 11!!! To make it worst we had somebody take a drink order another server taking our order, another bringing our appetizers that we order before they brought some chips and salsa the first server said there were going to bring,,,"we had to ask for them" we had a very bad experience here will never come back!!! O is my grade for this Chillis it was our first time and last time here,,,I have to give them a star because Yelp won't let you give them 0000!!

This is a very nice, but sometimes crowded location. Given Chili's proximity to the NAU campus, the place is always packed!  Yes, the food is typical Chili's fare, but because a great many students who work here are also in NAU's hospitality program, the service and food prep is excellent!  We have been here many times over the last four years and have always had an enjoyable time.  The staff is outstanding and the wait staff goes out of their way to be helpful. Enjoy!
I ordered take out and was very happy with the flavor of the food and the temperature.Very friendly service.  When in Flagstaff, go here.  Enough said...

We had a great server  (her name was Ashley). She was super quick to get our food, and it was really hot, she always had our drinks refilled even if they weren't all the way empty. Try the new shrimp tacos, they're very good and have a nice bite to them.
Stopped in for chips and salsa in the bar. Heather was our waitress and was really nice.  3.99 margaritas!!!!

I never expected to be writing a review for any Chile's in any state in our great union.  This is the kind of chain I never go to.  Oh, years ago, when I first discovered it in Florida, I thought it was the cat's meow.  But then I grew up, my taste buds got more refined, and a looked in disdain at the name and the people who would patronize it.  If anyone had told me I'd be giving this place five stars, I would have thought they'd had a psychological breakdown. But here we were in Flagstaff, on our way to Sedona.  It was raining and cold. It was late-ish. The first place we tried to go to had just closed.  We wanted to take a break, eat some dinner, and be on our way.  So we decided to "slum" and stop at Chili's. What a revelation!!   We decided to go with the 2 for $20 special, and started with the Guacamole and Chips.  Stupendous!  The chips were light, crisp, and not overly salted.  The guacamole was a huge portion, bigger than what you'd pay $10 or more at a high-end restaurant.  And it was better!  It tasted freshly made, with big chunks of avocado, tomato, and onion, and well-spiced. I had Margarita Chicken, and it was very, very good.  There were two pieces of chicken, and after all that guacamole, I couldn't finish it.  Hubby ordered Cajun Pasta with chicken, but he didn't want the Alfredo sauce it came with.  No problem - the waiter cheerfully said he could get it with marinara sauce. Despite the fact that we weren't drinking anything except water, and our bill was going to be relatively small, our server, Chris S., was attentive, helpful, and just downright nice.  We were on our way to stay at a timeshare resort, so we knew we'd have a fridge.  Chris brought the box for our chicken, and offered to pack up the chips and salsa (which was also very good) too.  We should have gotten an order of guacamole to go, but thought of it too late!! I'm hoping that the Flagstaff Chili's isn't an aberration, and I'll be trying it out in a couple of different states soon to see if they know something in Flagstaff that the rest of Chili's doesn't know.  I hope not!!

Chili's is Chili's. If you've been to one, then this place probably won't be any different than any other one you've been to. The hostesses and servers are upbeat and friendly for the most part, and the food always tastes the same. My only complaint about this particular location is that it's often a pain to pick up your food if you've ordered it online. It takes a while for them to actually come back and attend to you, but they're usually always friendly about it. It's a very convenient location being close to NAU and right off of MIlton.
For a crowded restaurant the team here served us well and was very attentive. Food was great and the taco pizza is deceptively filling.

After a bad dinner the previous night at Olive Garden, decided to try Chili's.  We were greeted at the door, seated immediately.  Our cashier, Meg was attentive and efficient.  She let us linger between the chips/salsa & meal.  She reminded me that they have strawberry lemonade which was a nice treat.  Even though we were just eating turkey sandwiches, they were tasty and way too much food after all the chips/salsa/queso......A very good experience!!!!!!!!

We ordered 2 apps an shared; it worked as our meal. It was late an we didn't want a full coarse meal. I thought it was good in my opinion, but my bf had to dip the sliders in ranch bc they were so dry. The server was new an he did an okay job. Nothing fancy but it worked! Our apps/food arrived fast which was nice bc we were starving!

Went there twice.  First time was fajitas.   The vegetables were put on the fajita skillet raw in the kitchen and were suppose to be cooked by the time they were carried to your table.  Hard and not even warm.  No flavor.  Bad service.  We had to wait for 15 minutes for change.  I guess the waiter thought we would give him a $20 tip for bad service if he delayed giving us back change. Second time ordered the rib eye steak.  We have had steak in other chili's and it was cooked over fire grill.  Not in Flagstaff.  It looked (grey) and tasted like it had been boiled in water.  Nasty. Screw me twice Chili's....Never again!

There is always a reason to go to Chilis. I love to sit in the bar area because I'm a huge football fan. It seems like you get everything faster in the bar. The servers love to talk sports too. Plus love the happy hour specials too

Not their best night. I am visiting friends in town and we decided to go to Chili's.   In a nut shell the service was not to their usual high standards and our waitress was over committed or very forgetful.  It took 15 minutes for the drinks to arrive and refills did not occur without flagging a different staff person down.  The meals were not correct.   In their defense, it was the night before Thanks giving and so I am sure the management must have had issues staffing tonight and it was evident.  I really would have given them a no star but I think I should give them grace on the day before Thanksgiving.

Went in not expecting much.  I've been to "Chili's" before in Hawaii, quite a few times.  We were VERY lucky to have Loren as a server!  She is one the most honestly heart warming people you will meet!   She made what I expected to be just a meal near the hotel on vacation, to a high point of the trip to Arizona.  I will also add, the country fried steak was spectacular!

Stopped in for lunch, sat at the bar.  Lunch specials are quite a deal.  $6, $7, $8 options, include soup or salad, with an entree option.  Ordered the Chicken Fajitas with a side salad ($8 option).  The service was great, attentive, and relatively quick.   Out the door for $8.83, with a $2.00 tip on top.   One complaint, why do I need a tip %age breakdown on my receipt?  What %age of Chili's customers need it, I wonder how much they paid a consultant to evaluate the impact of said breakdown in encouraging consumers to up/lower and/or tip, in general.

Thanks so much to Cody for the OUTSTANDING service!  After a long day on the road he made the evening memorable and gave us some great advice on hitting the Grand Canyon for a romantic sunrise since our delayed flight had compromised the sunset plans.  If we are ever in town again, we will definitely stop back and hope to have Cody as our server.

OK may be it was just a off night for our waitress, a smile would go a long way , floor was dirty , no pre buss of glass empty, on table, food just OK no big thing just OK .With all the new people in town you would think the staff would go out of the way to welcom  the family's of N.A.U  we do come back.

Sat in the bar and enjoyed happy hour beer and margarita. Draft beer selection was limited. House margarita was very good. We had the Margarita Chicken Fresh Mex Bowl and the Classic Sirloin. Both were excellent!

Good food, fast service.  But, they've taken all the vegetarian main-course items off the  menu!  e.g. no more cheese enchiladas, just appetizer stuff.  That would seem to be bad for business, especially in a town like Flagstaff.

I have had the worst service in the bar area recently. I go into the "lounge" area because they always have a good deal on drinks. But, recently the past three times I've been here 1. No one notices we are sitting there 2. The server gets our order wrong/it takes too long for it to come 3. The server doesn't listen to what I say about the check and charges me wrong. Honestly it's exhausting to know that no matter what time of day I will be getting poor service.

We spent a Thursday football night here, and really enjoyed ourselves. We claimed two seats at the bar , the bartender was a nice kid, yes, we are a little older (50s), but he was right on top of our needs. I had a small sirloin, really tender for Medium, and the wife a chicken salad, we were both pleased with our choices.  They do a nice job here, and even allowed a few older ahem folks in.
Been here with large groups and had a good time. It was very safe for vegetarians, which is always great.  The service was fantastic and we had a great night. I recommend for a quick meal on Milton.

Chili's is dependable in its simplicity... Arguably, nothing exciting has come out of this franchise chain since their catchy "I want my baby back baby back baby back..." jingle, immortalized as a part of pop culture by the likes of Austin Powers movies,  etc. And yet, this Chili's sort of stood out to me. On our recent trip to northern Arizona, my young family and I were looking for a place that would be kid friendly, but not annoying like Chuck E. Cheese, or poisonous like McDonald's.  Like Trusty's proverbial grandpappy, Old Reliable from Lady and the Tramp, Chili's glowed bright against the horizon, a beacon of hope on our journey for food before the roads froze. What made this particular location stand out was the service.  It's not always easy to go into a restaurant with three children under six years old.  My kids are pretty well behaved, but still, other guests sometimes rush to judgment at the mere seating of us within three tables of them. Likewise, I've seen servers arguing over who will get stuck at our table.  The jokes on them, because I always tip big when we bring our kids out to dinner, and bigger when people go above and beyond. Our server gave us the little extras like refills on soup at no charge because the kids slurped ours down, extra napkins and kids drink refills without being asked, and "accidentally" making a small dessert, bringing it to the table... And then leaving it, "because they'll just throw it away in the back anyway... You might as well enjoy it with your kids." This is the kind of above and beyond service that, sadly, often leads to servers moving on from restaurants like this, and going to places where sides are ordered separately to the tune of $25 apiece.  But sufficient for a day is its own evil, and we were very happy with our experience.

My boyfriend and I eat at Chili's all the time. With a college schedule and minimum wage jobs, Chili's provides the perfect date night meal with their 2-for-20 meal deals. We usually get the same thing, both ordering either burgers or the Cajun pasta with the chips and salsa or Texas cheese fries. We always, ALWAYS, have amazing service and amazing food. The atmosphere is pleasant and we can always catch an interesting game on the TV's.  Recently, we ordered our usual chips and salsa and a little splurge with getting their delicious skillet queso and the Cajun chicken pasta. However, when our pasta came, both him and I noticed the texture of the noodles to be rubbery and dry. We've never had a problem before so we reported it to our waiter who took it away right away with apologies and a smile, saying he would quickly bring it back better.  The next thing we know, the manager comes out apologizing to us and asking what exactly the problem was, as to not repeat it or to give it to any other customers. After she left, the waiter returned with our bill and told us that our queso had been removed from the bill and that they tested the noodles and the batch did seem somewhat under-cooked and apologized repeatedly. We both thanked him repeatedly and left a hefty tip and a note thanking the staff once again. This restaurant has never dissapointed me. Ive been to Chilis with awful service but this one has never let us down. Ive worked for 4 restaurants and have been a manager. I know that sometimes, especially in a lunch rush, things can slip through the cracks. I appreciate the effort by this staff so incredibly much because dining is an experience, its more than the food. its the atmosphere. 5 stars for fixing your mistake and not punishing us for it!! Love this chilis and the staff. Will always recommend!!!!

Very busy, graduation day at NAU.  Adequate parking. Prompt seating for 10 people. Good waitstaff. Prompt drink refills and same for salsa and chips.The chicken in the sandwich would pass for a level II ballistic vest,but the tomato was surprisingly good. The French fries were the standard variety...best when eaten hot .The salsa had flavor and mobility. It ran off the chips leaving a thin transient coating with much of the flavor remaining. The spinach queso was nicely done and tasty.The  watermelon and strawberry lemonades were a pleasing drink.  Overall there was mostly good in both service and food. The cats will love the chicken.

Why can't you get my order right? It's not busy tonight. My order is 3 things so why do you forget 1 of the items. It's not hard but you do it every time. Not impressed. Not the first time I go away wanting more.

The lunch BLT was served on a pretzel roll w/ fries and also came with a bowl of hearty chili topped with cheese and two cracker packages ($6). Service was attentive. You can sign up for their rewards program, order drink refills, browse the menu, and play games ($0.99)  on the table-top Ziosk unit.

We visited Chili's last night 12/31/2015.  We drive up from Phoenix and stopped there on our way to hotel.  We ordered the Texas cheese fries.  It came with 2 ranch cups...one of which had a VERY visible black hair foaming on top.  We asked our server to have a manager stop by our table.  He did and we showed him the hair.  He quickly brought us a new ranch, BUT did not compensate us in anyway. Being a former restaurant server, trainer and manager I was shocked.  At the very least he should have taken the app of the bill.  Very disappointing and we will never return to this chilis again...OHHHH and forgot to mention that there wasn't any avocado on my turkey club....ahhh

Worst dining experience of my life. Aye here on 1/23/16 around 10:30 pm, was greeted with cold unappetizing food that legitimately was awful. Server was nice enough but check took a while to come out. Would not recommend- go downtown and have a good mea at a brewery type place for the same price.

Worst Chilis food I've ever had! Usually I love chilis and their burgers. This time on 2/7/16 my burger and fries were dry and cold. The appetizer bone-in bbq wings were disgusting with fat everywhere on them. And smelt funny. yuck.
Probably the worst food I have had at chili's. the beef enchaladas wear unseasoned and dry.

Never had a bad experience. Wish the potato skins will still on the menu though. You can never go wrong with the 2 for $20 when you're dining with another person. Last time we went, our waiter Conor was a riot. Had us laughing the whole time.
A great place for a good meal. The service is average and the food quality is good. The only negative is how full and busy they get. Definitely call ahead or check in online.
Never can go wrong with the 2 for $20! The steak, bacon burger, quesadillas are all my favorite. Oh and their skillet mashed potatoes !

Love Chili's for dinner, but Chili's to go for lunch is a joke. Called in over 30 minutes prior to picking up my order. Confirmed my pick up time with the person on the phone who took my order and it still wasn't ready until 20 minutes after that agreed upon time. I only have a 30 minute lunch break which is why I called it in earlier. I would let this slide as an isolated incident except that the same problem happened to my coworker about a week ago. No apologies were made about why it took so long. I would have complained to the manager in the restaurant but I had run out of time already.

Summary based on 1 dinner: --looking for a predictable experience after a not so great local restaurant dinner. Got it. --about a 15 minute wait to be seated --ok food --ok service --reasonable prices --easy parking Some interesting tech on the table, allowing joining their loyalty club, paying the bill, and some other functions.

Pulled into Flagstaff late after a long drive and just wanted to get a quick meal. I sat in the bar to watch the basketball game. The service was exceptional as they have quite a decent selection of beer on tap. I ordered an appetizer of chips and salsa while I perused the menu and it arrived quickly. When I decided what I wanted, I would be making a few changes to an item on the menu and the wait staff took the order without hesitation. My dinner arrived without mistake and I left within the hour. No complaints from this gal.

What can I say was here again and had to come here to eat .last time is here we ate here it was excellent food it was excellent .again this time I had their i Alada burrito New York cheesecake guacamole and chip.. I hate so much my stomach hurt how do you walk over to target and get my grandson a pair shoes and walk some of the food off yeah it was that good. All of us liked what we ordered it was good.

My family and I came here excited and left upset to say the least. We came in and got seated right away, we saw that everyone else looked impatient, we figured they were understaffed and being that we're servers we understood. We looked at the menu decided what we wanted and waited for about 15 minutes. Another couple got seated on the table next to us and not even 5 mins later the server of the section gets their drink order and doesn't acknowledge us. We got up and left. It was clear that he was the server for that section, so I'm unsure as to why we were ignored. We will not be returning.

Seriously Chili's? First of all, The chicken was cold  Second of all, you guys took so long I thought you made Hot fresh chicken Third of all, you gave a little bit of chicken on my salad come on Chili's don't be like Chipotle  Guy's you should do better

Sat down right away which is always a plus!! waiter took drink order dropped them off and was gone for long periods of time for no refills. Ordered chips and queso they came all stuck together and greasy. Picture attached....my daughter didnt get her mac and cheese and when it did finally come it was cold. Enchiladas the corn tortillas were not cooked. Not the best Chili's experience it is a chain for god sake.
It was crowded but being the only Chili's out there i can see why waitress was great and i got to see a rainbow and the sunset at the same time.. the food was great, i love the ribs..

and again........not a fan of chains. But my kids and I are up in Flag, looking for a place to eat on a friday night.......is crazy. My kids suggest Chili's.....uhhh....... Now I just had my faith restored in Chili's a few months ago in Gilbert, it was great, so here we go again. First off, you put a little gaming thing on the table, we play with it, and on the bill you charge us for it???/     F U!!!!!   You got to be kidding me. 2nd, ordered the fajita's........5 strips of chicken and 5 strips of chewy crappy steak that was inedible. I went back to the hotel and threw it all up after. The food presentation is absolute disgusting, wilted lettuce, cold fries, and shitty soggy nachos. For a chain establishment, you should be ashamed of the food you serve here. The only bright spot was the polite waitress we had.  Chili's............never again.
I usually only go here for the happy hour food and drinks. Calvin in the bar area is a phenomenal server! He knows how to make mixed drinks and makes my visit pleasant.

Although our server was great, the restaurant was filthy and the food was mediocre.   It's a college town and obviously there are a lot of students working at this location, but they could use some more direction and guidance.  Tables near us were left dirty for nearly an hour and as we were leaving, the staff was sweeping a section with about 10 booths, in front of each one was a mound of trash.  They had the mounds of garbage on the ground as we were trying to walk through to exit.

I enjoy their frequent diner perks, although my opinions on the new one with Plenti is still in reserve.  They have a great happy hour at the bar, and finally they have craft beer and not just that macro brew swill.  My only gripe is that when I come on my own, they strongly steer me to the open seating bar area- las if a single person doesn't deserve her own table.

Chilis(this location) is lit. All the servers are very friendly, pretty, and handsome. The food is either great or just good. Never eaten bad food here, same with the drinks. I highly recommend this location. Chilis is prime boi.
Great service with great prices. Food was good And Alyssa the bartender that night was great
One of the better chain restaurants in Flagstaff and the Bartender was the best as we sat in his area!

Stopped in for dinner with my boyfriend the other night and we were not impressed. We've been to other locations but this one wasn't the greatest.  Due to recent health problems and allergies, my diet is extremely limited. It's a pain finding restaurants on vacation we can both enjoy. So I figured, Chili's must have something I can eat and we will both be happy. Not exactly how that turned out. Our server was nice, and I know how difficult and annoying it can be trying to accommodate someone with diet restrictions. But, you also need to understand that those people need the assurance they will be taken care of. I settled on the salmon, told her my allergies (so the kitchen or a manager would be aware), and that was it. I'm not sure if she told a manager or the kitchen about it; but it would've been nice to have someone come out and say,"hey just so you know, we are doing what we can to avoid cross contamination while cooking your food." This is always the standard at every restaurant I have worked at as well. I know it's not a 100% guarantee, and I'm aware there might be some cross contamination even when gloves are changed and the grill is cleaned, but it certainly lessens the chance.  My salmon tasted alright, definitely felt sick later though. My boyfriend said his food wasn't even that good (I think he ordered some wings and cheddar bites). Coming from a guy who will eat just about anything, it must've been pretty bad. It seems like the menu changed quite a bit since we last dined here and we weren't too impressed with it.
Always a great place - good service - I love their diet menu it is the bomb - Diet Coke (not Pepsi). Been coming for years around the country and never seem to get tired of it

First off let me say the only reason I am giving two stars is because our waiter was fantastic! That truly is the only thing that was good about this place. Are plates were small for the prices we paid and their was hardly any ice in our drinks. The food was just AWFUL! I never tasted such bad sauce on enchiladas ever and their was hardly any meat. The rice had no flavor or zing to it! Very, very disappointing all around. Unfortunately we will not be coming back.

As typical of Flagstaff, the service was the worst! We set for 10 minutes without our drinks. The manager just gave us cups of ice to pour our own from the drink station!  The waiter asked if we would like napkins?  I am not sure what training their waiters received, but I suspect it is none. Stay away if you would like to have anything to drink, a napkin, or food before your next meal!

We were a large party, 4 adults, 4 kids #1 Our server dropped a drink #2 Kept giving us nasty watered down lemonade when we kept telling her it wasn't good #3 We paid our bill, turns out it was the WRONG kiosk on the table so we paid someone else's bill! Had to wait for 20 mins for the Manager to FINALLY come over and fix it!  Service was horrible, Server and Manager didn't seem to care about anything. Won't be going back again.

What's wrong with the two pictures here? We ordered the pic 3 fajitas from the menu and look at what showed up. Attention management, at least come close next time. What a dumpster fire this was. Id suggest showing the menu to your chef, even the dishwasher could see there's no singularity between ehat i ordered and what i got.

This place is usually really good when I go in person, but the delivery last night was the absolute most disappointing meal of my life. My friend and I were starving and were very tired from moving in, so we thought we'd order some chili's. We each got such a small meal and you'd think they could get the order right, but no. My friend ordered the chicken enchilada meal with rice and beans, and she got no rice and beans. The enchilada was bad quality and there was way too much soggy sauce that gave both of us a stomach ache. I ordered a chicken crisper meal, and they gave me about 4 fries total, all soggy. The chicken I got was some random chopped up, soggy grilled chicken. Also no dipping sauce. This experience made me not want to ever eat from chili's again. Very disappointed.

The food tool forever and my steak taste like it was microwaved An thrown in a pan. My boyfriends ribs were dry, cheddar smoked sausage was cold and corn was dried out. Waiter did what he could but poor guy can't do the cooking... I will not return

My colleagues and I were working late and this one of the few options available. My one colleague chose it because he wanted lava cake. Badly. So we took the plunge, after possibly 20 years since my last visit. We loved our waitress Kendra. (She had dreads, along w many of the other servers.) I had the salmon, and it was pretty tasty (for being frozen). And we had fun playing trivia at the entertainment system on the table.

I really like this location, very friendly and efficient service and great food. It's not too loud (I've been here many times) and the food is delicious and made to order!  I know Chili's has gotten a bad wrap in the past for various reasons, but remember everyone has an opinion and it's there experience. Have a great day!
1/2 rack ribs was very dry...maybe in oven an hour too long. Next table was upset that their food came with the appetizer. Aside from that, dinner was ok.

2 for 20$ yes plz. Good food and a nice spot to enjoy some dinner with friends. Texas cheese fries are a must. 3.5 stars. The place is staffed and clean, burger is pretty good tho there's a few places around flag I prefer over chilis burgers.
